citation.excerpt:
*LevelGraph builds on the excellent work on both the LevelUp community
and the LevelDB and Snappy teams from Google and additional contributors.
LevelDB and Snappy are both issued under the [New BSD Licence](http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause).*

contributingGuidelines.excerpt:
LevelGraph is an OPEN Open Source Project
What?
Individuals making significant and valuable contributions are given commit-access to the project to contribute as they see fit. This project is more like an open wiki than a standard guarded open source project.
Rules
There are a few basic ground-rules for contributors:

No --force pushes or modifying the Git history in any way.
Non-master branches ought to be used for ongoing work.
External API changes and significant modifications ought to be subject to an internal pull-request to solicit feedback from other contributors.
Internal pull-requests to solicit feedback are encouraged for any other non-trivial contribution but left to the discretion of the contributor.
Contributors should attempt to adhere to the prevailing code-style.

Releases
Declaring formal releases remains the prerogative of the project maintainer.
Changes to this arrangement
This is an experiment and feedback is welcome! This document may also be subject to pull-requests or changes by contributors where you believe you have something valuable to add or change.

excerpt.body:
- Updated readme logo reference
- Added `tmp` dependency
- Fix hexastore link in readme
- Replaced [level-browserify](https://npmjs.com/package/level-browserify) by [level](https://npmjs.com/package/level), due to level-browserify not installing on newer node versions anymore and level now supporting browser environments
- Stream closing in `test/triple_unicode_store_spec` and `test/triple_store_spec` are now done on the `end` instead of the `close` event due to a double-trigger of the `end` event. (this may warrant another bugfix in the future)
- Updated dev dependencies
  - [level-sublevel](https://npmjs.com/package/level-sublevel)
  - [multilevel](https://npmjs.com/package/multilevel)
  - [osenv](https://npmjs.com/package/osenv)
  - [setimmediate](https://npmjs.com/package/setimmediate)
  - [tmp](https://npmjs.com/package/tmp)
- Replaced range notation during the opening of read streams, changed from `start` and `end` to `gte` and `lte`
- Added CI based on github-actions, making new pull requests show the testing status on a known platform again
excerpt.name: v3.0.0

excerpt.body:
- Bumped dependencies
- allow non-array search parameter #160
excerpt.name: v2.0.0

excerpt.body: - Avoid throwing when calling `Object.keys()` on non-objects #138 by @capricube
excerpt.name: v1.1.3

excerpt.body:
- Updated to LevelUp 1.0.0
- Changed constructor signature
excerpt.name: v1.0.0

excerpt.body:
- Fixed exact matches support #85 #86 #119.
- Welcome @doowb as a committer!
excerpt.name: v0.10.5

excerpt.body: - Ufficially support node v0.12 and iojs.
excerpt.name: v0.10.4

excerpt.body: - Don't push falsy data in `search`, makes refuting work when filtering on full solutions (https://github.com/mcollina/levelgraph/pull/113).
excerpt.name: v0.10.3

excerpt.body:
- Handle unicode (chinese) characters in the triples (https://github.com/mcollina/levelgraph/pull/97)
- Added Riceball Lee as a contributor.
excerpt.name: v0.10.0

excerpt.body:
- Updated minified build
- Fixed Travis-CI tests
excerpt.name: v0.9.1

excerpt.body: - Fixed deferred open support for searches over IndexedDB.
excerpt.name: v0.8.1

excerpt.body:
- Store false values correctly [#55](https://github.com/mcollina/levelgraph/issues/55).
- Dependencies upgrade, including Browserify 3.
- Performance optimizations, +75% for `getStream`, and +25% for sort
  `search`.
excerpt.name: v0.8.0

excerpt.body:
- Fixed memory leak by upgrading to LevelUp 0.18 and LevelDown 0.10.
- Upgraded all testing dependencies.
- Formatting to proper jshint.
- Firefox support.
excerpt.name: v0.6.11

excerpt.body:
- Do not include vim undo files in the package.
- Added support for LevelUp 0.17
- Added support for LevelDown 0.9
excerpt.name: v0.6.10

excerpt.body: - Depending directly on LevelUp, LevelDOWN and Level.js.
excerpt.name: v0.6.8

support.excerpt:
__LevelGraph__ does not support out of the box loading serialized RDF or storing it. Such functionality is provided by extensions:
* [LevelGraph-N3](https://github.com/levelgraph/levelgraph-n3) - __N3/Turtle__
* [LevelGraph-JSONLD](https://github.com/levelgraph/levelgraph-jsonld) - __JSON-LD__
